page.title: 02FOUNDERS WELWYN GARDEN CITY
page.content: In 1898 {Mr Ebenezer Howard}published a book called {"Tomorrow a Peaceful {Path to Real Reform".}In 1902 it was revised and recalled {"Garden Cities {of Tomorrow" }In the month of May 1919 Mr Howard purchased 1453 acres in which he planned to build {Welwyn {Garden City. }The following year the {Welwyn Garden City Ltd. }was founded and {Theodore Chambers}was made chairman. The building of the first house commenced under the watchful eye of {Louis de Soissons.}The first house occupied was in Handside Lane. The same year {Mr Howard }bought 689 acres more. In 1922 tenders were accepted for the first Council Housing Scheme of 50 houses. By the end of June the population was 400! In {1927 Ebenezer {Howard }was knighted.
